Comments_List: General knowledge necessary to be an effective naval officer.
Basics of being a naval officer.
I was introduced to basic military knowledge include its structure, shipboard life in the Navy, different communities, leadership and ethics skills, and so much more.
The instructor is funny and I found the material to be engaging.
Could be later in the day. While I understand that getting up early is part of being in the Navy, it is tough when you're staying up till the wee hours of the morning studying most nights.

Strengths: really important information for future officers
Weaknesses: lots of memorization needed, information can be forgotten quickly (but the memorization is inevitable)
This class is a requirement for NROTC and I would definitely recommend this program.
I don't think this question applies to this class (given that it's required for only ROTC students).
